Ok. Cruise took about an hour, not 70 minutes, turned around 4 times and stopped to alight passengers at 2nd stop, which all lost time, the return is the same as going so really felt we only saw approx  20/25 minutes and that's mainly flats, graffiti, and waste ground.
Commentary was just a recording, so it is not very interactive and has no ability to ask or answer questions.
2x staff polite but not interactive either struggled to get basics of hello, thanks, & goodbye.
I booked in advance and paid Â£12 but on the day, people were charged Â£10 20% overcharge.
Tea coffee and snacks on board very reasonably priced.
Good time waster but wouldn't rush back,

A fantastic experience whether it is your first visit to York or you've grown up in the area - highly recommend!

text.text:
We enjoyed a lovely 45-minute boat trip on a busy and humid Saturday afternoon in September. The boat was very clean and comfortable, although the seating was a little cramped. The boat has toilets and a bar aboard, and there is seating downstairs as well as up on the top deck. We paid Â£14 per adult, which we thought was a tad expensive  for the trip.
The driver of the boat gave a commentary throughout the trip, which was informative but distracting, and his voice was memorable but not in a good way.
We got to see some lovely sights, which was nice, but I would rather hire a motorboat next time.

text.text: We had a lovely cruise on the largest of the tour boats, quite reasonably priced at Â£14 for 45 minutes. There's a on board bar, plus upstairs & downstairs seating with plenty of standing room in case you feel like stretching your legs mid journey. Slight gripe with the upstairs seating, the rows of chairs are spaced too closely & there's little room to cross or uncross legs + if someone on the chair closest to the edge wants to move, everybody on the row has to move with such little space. Otherwise a pleasant journey, recommended.

text.text:
We decided to go on the half hour boat trip as it was a bit of a miserable wet day & this was a good way to see more of the city. The guys running the trip were friendly and it was simple to just pay on board. However, when itâ€™s 15 mins in one direction and then 15 mins back, it goes very quickly and we werenâ€™t sure it was quite worth the cost of the ticket. Itâ€™s mostly big houses & rowing clubs in Boughton that you see along one side of the river before the boat turns just after Dee Banks School and heads back to where you started. Parts of the commentary were interesting & a way to learn more about the history of Chester. I think the 2 hour cruise is probably more worth the money.
They do have lots of really detailed accessibility information on their website though & have toilets on board but we didnâ€™t use them.

text.text: Took my 93 year old mum on the Sabrina yesterday. She absolutely loved it, and took the leaflets home so she could remember the commentary. As a local I was blown away by the 360 degree views at a slightly higher level than you get from The Quarry, really showed our beautiful town at its best. The boat is really quiet gas powered perhaps? The steward was charming and very helpful. Highly recommended.

text.text: Walking along the canal was a delightful experience. The peaceful waters and picturesque surroundings provided a perfect backdrop for a leisurely stroll. The towpath was well-maintained and easy to navigate, making it accessible for all ages. Whether you're looking to enjoy a peaceful walk, go for a jog, or simply soak in the tranquility of the waterway, the canal offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

text.text: The 9 of us were treated like royalty for an afternoon tea on cruise boat "Romance".  We were offered drinks of our choice and crisps. We were served sandwiches, amazing mini desserts and coffee or tea. The boat was tastefully decked out, scenery was beautiful as we smoothly sailed along, and the staff were wonderful. The whole experience was so therapeutic and we all thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon. Would recommend, and we're definitely returning. Thank you Riley Canal Cruises.

text.text: My wife and I hired out the Romance boat for our intimate wedding reception. The service provided by Bridie and the team was absolutely exceptional. They could not have been more friendly, helpful and accommodating with us in terms of what we were looking for. The trip itself, the food cooked, and the service received, was perfect. We could not have had a better day and would highly recommend Canal Boat Cruises to anyone looking for an afternoon out, or to hire for an event.

text.text:
It was 2019 when our sail & lunch was booked, owing to covid it was the 8th October 2021when we eventually had the experience . I must say we were very pleased with everything . All the staff were very polite , respectful ,friendly & pleasant . The barge diner was very clean & well set out. We had a three course  pre booked lunch with soup, roast chicken / beef to follow with a choice of deserts . Wine , spirits , hot & cold drinks available to order . The whole meal was expertly cooked & presented everything was perfect a reflection of the skill of the catering staff and waitress attendance . The barge diner is equipped with a flushing toilet . Access onto the barge for very tall people may be a little awkward in order not to hit their head but that said just have to be a little careful. We were fortunate it was a sunny day so the views were that much better . The sail lasted around three hours sailing from the birthing mid point along the canal in both directions .
Thank you for the experience we had and would recommend the venue without exception.

"The Romance" - the restaurant barge. A really delightful way to spend a Sunday lunchtime gently drifting along the canal. The barge was very neatly laid out and the tables nicely set..... and the three course meal did not disappoint. With a small but well stocked bar to compliment your luncheon and attentive and pleasant service from two staff on board. Impressive that with 20 something on board and in the confines of a small galley, the meals were prepared by one chef... hats off to him.
The three hours return journey was scenic and serene.
Thank you to all the staff and crew for such a wonderful time. Highly recommended.

text.text: This is an award winning, 5-star cruise company and I whole heartedly agree with the owners statement. They indeed offered my family a great Loch ness experience and even in the cloudy, rainy conditions we still saw some breathtaking scenery from our indoor seating. We booked the 1 hour tour on-line and was greeted by pleasant and friendly staff who portrayed a family feel and settled everyone down ready for the cruise. With easy boarding, an informative narrative, and plenty of interaction we all agreed that we did make those memories they claimed we would which we will not forget for a while. They offer a number of cruises which are all, in my view, value for money, the only downside is having to park at the other end of town as no parking available at site. That said it is not a long walk and you get to see the locks and road bridge and other things that Fort Augustus has to offer. Fully recommended and well worth the 5 stars.

Pro tip, buy your souvenirs on the cruise as it's much cheaper than the local gift shops!  Also there is a bar on the first deck!

text.text:
My partner and I recently took the Thames River Sightseeing boat cruise from Westminster Pier to Greenwich Pier and back, and it was a highlight of our London trip. For Â£39 for two adults, this felt like an incredible value.

We booked 25 minutes before the boat ride, which got us fantastic seats on the top deck at the front â€“ the perfect spot for views and photos. The live guided tour was informative, clear, and really entertaining! I loved learning about the history of the landmarks along the river.

The boat ride was so relaxing, giving us a whole new perspective on London. It's surprisingly tranquil from the water! The whole trip took about two hours, perfect for enjoying the beautiful weather. We now have a list of interesting pubs to try, thanks to our guide.

We'll absolutely do this again and spend more time exploring Greenwich next time. I'd highly recommend this cruise to anyone visiting London.

text.text:
â­â­â­â­â­

My recent experience with City Centre Cruises in Manchester was nothing short of exceptional! From the moment we stepped aboard Emmeline Pankhurst, it was evident that this was going to be an unforgettable journey.

Firstly, the food was outstanding! A delectable selection that not only tantalized the taste buds but also showcased the culinary expertise of the onboard chefs.

Yet, what truly made this experience extraordinary was the impeccable hospitality provided by Amon and Sarah. They epitomized cruise hospitality at its finest! Their warmth, attentiveness, and genuine care for every guest onboard added an extra layer of delight to the entire cruise.

Amon and Sarah's professionalism and friendliness were unparalleled. They effortlessly catered to every need, ensuring everyone felt welcomed and pampered throughout the journey. Their knowledge about the cruise, coupled with their enthusiasm, enhanced the overall experience significantly.

The ambiance onboard was delightful, the views of Manchester from the cruise were stunning, and the service was top-notch. But it was truly Amon and Sarah who elevated this experience to something truly memorable.

text.text:
Great little experience! We booked on for 2pm and was told to arrive 30 mins early for boarding, everything was on schedule. The owners of the boat were great, really informative and friendly and  we even got a couple of free drinks! Lots of information about the history of Birmingham canals and engineering.

A different, pleasant experience. Great value for money. We managed to catch some good weather, which enhanced the cruise.

Snacks and cold drinks available, and the cheapest beer in Birmingham centre! I think tea and coffees would be brilliant, if possible. Definitely recommended if your in Birmingham.

text.text: We were just passing and looking for something to do and found this opportunity to explore a bit of Birmingham we had never seen before. At Â£6 for adults this trip along part of the canal system travelling round Birminghams only island was an interesting experience. The guide did very well to explain many aspects of the development of the canal network. Despite some challengingly noisy, very young children on board with little effort by their parents to control their playtime she soldiered on to pass on some of her wisdom to the passengers who were interested in learning more. If you are looking to discover more about Birminghamâ€™s canal history this is a great way to spend your time.

text.text: Our large family party of very mixed ages celebrated my 70th birthday with a wonderful afternoon tea cruise. Due to bereavement the event, planned for last April, had to be postponed for a year. The staff of Georgie's were exceptionally understanding and helpful and extremely nice to deal with and this general tone was reflected in all aspects of the planning and execution of the day. The staff on board were very friendly and efficient, and anxious to help in any way possible. They were also very tolerant of small children in their way! The boat was really attractive with beautifully laid tables, each with vases of fresh daffodils and tea lights, and the tea itself was generous and delicious. I could not fault the service and would thoroughly recommend Georgie's Canal Cruises.

text.text:
A great idea for somewhere different to take your favourite person or people for a meal or birthday do.
We were invited to a birthday surprise on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. Normal tables and chairs are set out with enough room to sit comfortably. Big windows to look out and a journey down the canal for about an hour each way was plenty of time for dinner, a pudding and coffee.
A decent bar on board and a toilet for those in need.
Probably not the best views of the countryside but interesting enough, especially through the two locks if you haven't done it before. A few minor bit of rocking when you get on, but soon get used to it.
Staff were really friendly.
Overall it was a great little trip and good food. Will definitely do it again if the right situation comes up in the near future.

text.text:
The London Eye River Cruise is a delightful and scenic way to explore the iconic River Thames and soak in the breathtaking sights of London. Departing from the London Eye Pier, this leisurely boat tour takes passengers on a captivating journey along the river, offering panoramic views of the city's most famous landmarks.

As you embark on the cruise, you'll find yourself gliding past a picturesque backdrop of historic and modern architecture. From the majestic Tower Bridge to the grandeur of the Houses of Parliament and the iconic London Eye itself, the cruise provides a unique vantage point to admire these renowned landmarks from a different perspective.

The knowledgeable guides onboard share fascinating stories and interesting facts about the history, culture, and significance of the sites along the river. Their commentary adds depth and context to the experience, allowing you to gain a deeper understanding of the rich heritage and vibrant atmosphere of London.

The cruise is not just about sightseeing; it also offers a relaxing and enjoyable experience on the water. As you drift along the river, you can sit back, unwind, and appreciate the tranquil surroundings. The gentle sway of the boat and the cool breeze create a soothing atmosphere, making it a perfect opportunity to take a break from the bustling city and enjoy a moment of tranquility.

The London Eye River Cruise is suitable for visitors of all ages and interests. Whether you're a history buff, a photography enthusiast, or simply someone who appreciates stunning cityscapes, the cruise provides a captivating journey that showcases the best of London's iconic landmarks.

The cruise itself typically lasts around 40 minutes, allowing ample time to capture memorable photographs, listen to the engaging commentary, and soak in the mesmerizing views. It's a fantastic way to capture the essence of London's riverside charm and create lasting memories.

With its convenient departure point near the London Eye, the river cruise is easily accessible and can be seamlessly combined with a visit to other nearby attractions or a leisurely stroll along the riverbank.

The London Eye River Cruise offers a unique and enchanting experience that combines sightseeing, relaxation, and informative commentary. It allows visitors to appreciate the beauty and grandeur of London's riverside landmarks while enjoying a serene journey along the iconic River Thames.

My recent experience with City Centre Cruises in Manchester was nothing short of exceptional! From the moment we stepped aboard Emmeline Pankhurst, it was evident that this was going to be an unforgettable journey.

Firstly, the food was outstanding! A delectable selection that not only tantalized the taste buds but also showcased the culinary expertise of the onboard chefs.

Yet, what truly made this experience extraordinary was the impeccable hospitality provided by Amon and Sarah. They epitomized cruise hospitality at its finest! Their warmth, attentiveness, and genuine care for every guest onboard added an extra layer of delight to the entire cruise.

Amon and Sarah's professionalism and friendliness were unparalleled. They effortlessly catered to every need, ensuring everyone felt welcomed and pampered throughout the journey. Their knowledge about the cruise, coupled with their enthusiasm, enhanced the overall experience significantly.

The ambiance onboard was delightful, the views of Manchester from the cruise were stunning, and the service was top-notch. But it was truly Amon and Sarah who elevated this experience to something truly memorable.
